get.description: List of certificates expiring within specified number of days

parameters.description: Request certificates expiring within this number of days
parameters.name: days

parameters.description: Next offset to display results of, if maxNumberOfResults is exceeded. Starts from 0.

get.summary: Get a list of certificates that are about to expire

put.description: Revokes the specified certificate, changes revocation reason for an already revoked certificate, sets invalidity or revocation date

parameters.description: Subject DN of the issuing CA
parameters.name: issuer_dn

parameters.description: Hex serial number (without prefix, e.g. '00')
parameters.name: certificate_serial_number

parameters.description:
Valid RFC5280 reason. One of
 NOT_REVOKED, UNSPECIFIED ,KEY_COMPROMISE,
 CA_COMPROMISE, AFFILIATION_CHANGED, SUPERSEDED, CESSATION_OF_OPERATION,
 CERTIFICATE_HOLD, REMOVE_FROM_CRL, PRIVILEGES_WITHDRAWN, AA_COMPROMISE 

 Only KEY_COMPROMISE is allowed for new revocation reason if revocation reason is to be changed.
parameters.name: reason

parameters.description: ISO 8601 Date string, eg. '2018-06-15T14:07:09Z'. Will be ignored with revocation reason REMOVE_FROM_CRL
parameters.name: invalidity_date

get.description: Returns the configdump data in JSON.

parameters.description:
Configuration type to export.

Supported types are: ACMECONFIG/acme-config, AUTOENROLLMENTCONFIG/autoenrollment-config, CA/certification-authorities,  CRYPTOTOKEN/crypto-tokens, PUBLISHER/publishers, APPROVALPROFILE/approval-profiles, CERTPROFILE/certificate-profiles, EEPROFILE/end-entity-profiles, SERVICE/services, ROLE/admin-roles, KEYBINDING/internal-key-bindings, ADMINPREFS/admin-preferences, OCSPCONFIG/ocsp-configuration, PEERCONNECTOR/peer-connectors, SCEPCONFIG/scep-config, CMPCONFIG/cmp-config, ESTCONFIG/est-config, VALIDATOR/validators, CTLOG/ct-logs, EXTENDEDKEYUSAGE/extended-key-usage, CERTEXTENSION/custom-certificate-extensions,  OAUTHKEY/trusted-oauth-providers, AVAILABLEPROTOCOLS/available-protocols
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: Individual configuration name to export
parameters.name: setting

parameters.description: Print a warning instead of aborting and throwing an exception on errors.
parameters.name: ignoreerrors

parameters.description: Also include fields having the default value.
parameters.name: defaults

get.summary: Get the configuration for a type and setting in JSON.

get.description: Returns a zip archive of YAML files.

parameters.description: Print a warning instead of aborting and throwing an exception on errors.
parameters.name: ignoreerrors

parameters.description: Also include fields having the default value.
parameters.name: defaults

parameters.description: Enables export of external CAs (i.e. CAs where there's only a certificate and nothing else)
parameters.name: externalcas

parameters.description: Names of items/types to include in the export. The syntax is identical to that of exclude. For items of types that aren't listed, everything is included.
parameters.name: include

parameters.description:
Names of items/types to exclude in the export, separated by semicolon. Type and name is separated by a colon, and wildcards "\*" are allowed. Both are case-insensitive. E.g. exclude="\*:Example CA;cryptotoken:Example\*;systemconfiguration:\*".

Supported types are: ACMECONFIG/acme-config, AUTOENROLLMENTCONFIG/autoenrollment-config, CA/certification-authorities,  CRYPTOTOKEN/crypto-tokens, PUBLISHER/publishers, APPROVALPROFILE/approval-profiles, CERTPROFILE/certificate-profiles, EEPROFILE/end-entity-profiles, SERVICE/services, ROLE/admin-roles, KEYBINDING/internal-key-bindings, ADMINPREFS/admin-preferences, OCSPCONFIG/ocsp-configuration, PEERCONNECTOR/peer-connectors, SCEPCONFIG/scep-config, CMPCONFIG/cmp-config, ESTCONFIG/est-config, VALIDATOR/validators, CTLOG/ct-logs, EXTENDEDKEYUSAGE/extended-key-usage, CERTEXTENSION/custom-certificate-extensions,  OAUTHKEY/trusted-oauth-providers, AVAILABLEPROTOCOLS/available-protocols
parameters.name: exclude

get.summary: Get the configuration as a ZIP file.

parameters.description: Expand variables by replacing references in form ${VARIABLE_NAME} with values of matching environment variables, e.g. VARIABLE_NAME.
parameters.name: expand

post.summary: Put the configuration as a ZIP file.

parameters.description: Also include fields having the default value.
parameters.name: defaults

parameters.description: Enables export of external CAs (i.e. CAs where there's only a certificate and nothing else)
parameters.name: externalcas

parameters.description: Names of items/types to include in the export. The syntax is identical to that of exclude. For items of types that aren't listed, everything is included.

parameters.description:
Names of items/types to exclude in the export, separated by semicolon. Type and name is separated by a colon, and wildcards "\*" are allowed. Both are case-insensitive. E.g. exclude="\*:Example CA;cryptotoken:Example\*;systemconfiguration:\*".

Supported types are: ACMECONFIG/acme-config, AUTOENROLLMENTCONFIG/autoenrollment-config, CA/certification-authorities, CRYPTOTOKEN/crypto-tokens, PUBLISHER/publishers, APPROVALPROFILE/approval-profiles, CERTPROFILE/certificate-profiles, EEPROFILE/end-entity-profiles, SERVICE/services, ROLE/admin-roles, KEYBINDING/internal-key-bindings, ADMINPREFS/admin-preferences, OCSPCONFIG/ocsp-configuration, PEERCONNECTOR/peer-connectors, SCEPCONFIG/scep-config, CMPCONFIG/cmp-config, ESTCONFIG/est-config, VALIDATOR/validators, CTLOG/ct-logs, EXTENDEDKEYUSAGE/extended-key-usage, CERTEXTENSION/custom-certificate-extensions,  OAUTHKEY/trusted-oauth-providers, AVAILABLEPROTOCOLS/available-protocols
parameters.name: exclude

get.description: Retrieves a CA's public key in SSH format.

put.description: Run service with the provided name

parameters.description: Name of the service to run
parameters.name: service_name

external.description: Is external (whether CA certificate was imported)

value.description: A search value. This could be sting value, ISO 8601 Date string, an appropriate string name of End Entity Profile or Certificate Profile or CA

operation.description: An operation for property on inserted value. 'EQUAL' for string, 'LIKE' for string value ('QUERY'), 'BEGINS_WITH' for string value (case sensitive trailing wildcard search.), 'BEFORE' or 'AFTER' for date values

example.certificate_request:
MIICh...V8shQ== OR -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE REQUEST-----
MIICh...V8shQ==
-----END CERTIFICATE REQUEST-----

certificate_request.example:
MIICh...V8shQ== OR -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE REQUEST-----
MIICh...V8shQ==
-----END CERTIFICATE REQUEST-----

example.certificate_request:
MIICh...V8shQ== OR -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE REQUEST-----
MIICh...V8shQ==
-----END CERTIFICATE REQUEST-----

certificate_request.example:
MIICh...V8shQ== OR -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE REQUEST-----
MIICh...V8shQ==
-----END CERTIFICATE REQUEST-----

expire_date.description: Date after which certificate should be considered expired

not_before.description: Date at which certificate became valid

SearchCertificateSortRestRequest.description:
Use one of allowed values as property and operation.
Available propertiesUSERNAME 
ISSUER_DN 
SUBJECT_DN 
EXTERNAL_ACCOUNT_BINDING_ID 
END_ENTITY_PROFILE 
CERTIFICATE_PROFILE 
STATUS 
TAG 
TYPE 
UPDATE_TIME 
ISSUED_DATE 
EXPIRE_DATE 
REVOCATION_DATE 

Available operationsASC 
DESC

operation.description: Sort ascending or descending. 'ASC' for ascending, 'DESC' for descending.

count.description: The quantity of issued or active certificates

key_pair_alias.description: Key pair aliasof the key pair to be generated, must not already exist

key_alg.description: Key algorithm, required for some algorithms, RSA, not required for others like EC or ML-DSA

key_spec.description: Key specification, key size, curve or name, must be supported by the underlying crypto token, like 4096 for RSA or secp256r1 for EC

key_usage.description: Optional key usage, affects some crypto tokens (PKCS#11 NG) but not most others. Values SIGN, ENCRYPT, SIGN_ENCRYPT

name.description: For extension_data a certificate extension object identifier (OID), for custom_data a string variable and value see ExtendedInformation class

value.description: A search value. This could be string value, an appropriate string name of End Entity Profile or Certificate Profile or CA

operation.description: An operation for property on inserted value. 'EQUALS' for string, 'LIKE' for string value ('QUERY')

EndEntityRevocationRestRequest.description:
End Entity revocation request. Available reason codes: 
 0 - Unspecified,
 1 - Key Compromise,
 2 - CA Compromise,
 3 - Affiliation Changed,
 4 - Superseded,
 5 - Cessation of Operation,
 6 - Certificate Hold,
 8 - Remove from CRL,
 9 - Privileges Withdrawn,
 10 - AA Compromise

subject_alternative_name_fields.description: List of Subject Alternative Name fields

SearchEndEntitiesSortRestRequest.description:
Use one of allowed values as property and operation.
Available propertiesUSERNAME 
SUBJECT_DN 
SUBJECT_ALT_NAME 
END_ENTITY_PROFILE(by databse identifier, not user-given name) 
CERTIFICATE_PROFILE(by identifier) 
CA(by identifier) 
STATUS 
UPDATE_TIME 
CREATED_DATE 

Available operationsASC 
DESC

operation.description: Sort ascending or descending. 'ASC' for ascending, 'DESC' for descending.

zipfile.description: A zipfile containing directories of YAML files.

ignoreerrors.description: Add to warnings instead of aborting on errors.

initialize.description: Generate initial certificate for CAs on import

continue.description: Continue on errors. Default is to abort.

overwrite.description: How to handle already existing configuration. Options are abort,skip,yes

resolve.description: How to resolve missing references. Options are abort,skip,default
